result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Court entered not guilty plea for defendant. Motions due 20 days. Bail continued.
Branch 2

2:53 PM Defendant Jonathan A Hufton in court with Attorney Kim Marie Zion.  Attorney Lillian Rose Nelson in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Zion requests to address motion to dismiss complaint. Atty Nelson with response. Court makes findings and denies motion to dismiss. State requests all felony counts to be transactionally related. Objection made. State with response. Court finds 3 and 4 to be transactionally related. Law enforcement duly sworn and testified. Direct Exam by ADA. Venue established. Witness identification. Cross Exam by Atty Zion. ADA with re-direct. Witness excused. State moves for bind over, waived argument, reserve rebuttal. Defn objected to bind over; makes argument. ADA with rebuttal. CT found PC this defn committed a felony and bound over to branch.

3:31 PM M.W. makes statement on the record. ADA with requests bond conditions to remain in place. Atty Zion with response. Bail/bond amends that DE shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with CJH, NAH, NMH, MH, or AJH except only as permitted as specifically authorized in case 19FA1155. All other conditions remain the same.
filed by Atty Zion

filed by Atty Zion

1:55 PM Defendant Jonathan A Hufton in court.  Attorney Kim Marie Zion in court for Jonathan A Hufton.  Attorney Lillian Nelson in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Zion makes arguments as to why complaint should be dismissed.  State makes arguments.  Rebuttal by Atty Zion. Court grants leave to file an amended complaint and re-set for preliminary hearing.  No objection from State.  Atty Zion asks for quick timeline.  State has until October 7 to file the amended complaint.  Preliminary hearing re-set for October 13, 2022.
Preliminary hearing on October 13, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

08:34 AM Defendant in court with Attorney Kim Marie Zion.  Lexi Keyes appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Appearance by victim. The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts. Statement by victim.  Status conference scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 01:20 pm.
